item.dc:title: Ewan McGregor: Cold Chain Mission
item.dc:description: 1/2. Ewan McGregor is on a mission to immunise some of the hardest-to-reach children in the world. He starts in India and then continues to Nepal. Contains some strong language. Also in HD. [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Ewan McGregor: Cold Chain Mission
item.dc:description: 2/2. In this two-part film, Ewan McGregor is on a mission to immunise some of the hardest-to-reach children in the world. In the second episode, Ewan journeys up the mighty Congo River. [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
item.dc:description: 3/6. Kenya to Somaliland: Simon Reeve travels from the coral coast of Kenya to the troubled Horn of Africa on the third leg of his Indian Ocean journey. [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
item.dc:description: 4/6. Oman to the Maldives: This stage of Simon Reeve's journey takes him from Oman to the Maldives, via Mumbai. He starts in the remote Musandam peninsula on the Strait of Hormuz. [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Olympics 2012: Opening Ceremony
item.dc:description: From the Olympic Stadium, the 30th Olympiad is officially declared open by Her Majesty the Queen. The event features a stunning cultural show ahead of the athletes' parade. [HD] [S]

item.dc:title: Olympics 2012: Closing Ceremony
item.dc:description: A celebration of British music, orchestrated by Kim Gavin, forms the centrepiece as the curtain comes down on the 30th Olympiad. Contains flashing images. [HD] [S]

item.dc:title: Pride & Prejudice
item.dc:description: Lavish costume drama starring Keira Knightley and Matthew Macfadyen, 2005. Based on Jane Austen's novel about five sisters in Georgian England in search of single men of large fortunes.

item.dc:title: Paralympic Games Closing Ceremony
item.dc:description: Jon Snow presents the Festival of Flame, the London 2012 Paralympic Closing Ceremony, with Coldplay performing alongside a cast of almost 2000 in the Olympic Stadium.

item.dc:title: Australia with Simon Reeve
item.dc:description: New series. 1/3. Simon Reeve begins an extraordinary adventure across the great continent of Australia. Also in HD. [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Australia with Simon Reeve
item.dc:description: 2/3. Simon Reeve travels from Darwin in Australia's Northern Territory, across to the Cape York Peninsula, and on to the Great Barrier Reef. Contains some upsetting scenes. Also in HD. [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Before Sunrise
item.dc:description: Romance starring Julie Delpy and Ethan Hawke. Two twentysomethings meet on a train and decide to spend a few hours together. Contains some strong language. Also in HD. [1995] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Luther
item.dc:description: New series. 1/4. Luther investigates two horrific cases, unaware his every step is under scrutiny. Contains some violence and disturbing scenes. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Luther
item.dc:description: 2/4. Crime drama series. The killer has struck again. Luther trawls through cold case files, determined to try and predict the fetishist's next move. Contains disturbing scenes. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Luther
item.dc:description: 4/4. Crime drama series. Accused of crimes he has not committed, Luther must work quickly to clear his name and stop the vigilante killer from becoming a martyr. Contains some violence. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: New: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
item.dc:description: CBeebies Bedtime Hour. The Great Balloon Hullabaloo: An exciting story read by a special guest. Robert Webb reads The Great Balloon Hullabaloo, by Peter Bently and Mei Matsuoka. [S]

item.dc:title: New: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
item.dc:description: CBeebies Bedtime Hour. You're All My Favourites: An exciting story read by a special guest. Robert Webb reads You're All My Favourites, by Sam McBratney and Anita Jeram. [S]

item.dc:title: Torvill & Dean: The Perfect Day
item.dc:description: Documentary telling the story of when, in 1984, the British figure skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean achieved perfection and an Olympic gold medal. [HD] [S]

item.dc:title: W1A
item.dc:description: New series. 1/4. Comedy sequel to Twenty Twelve. With the London games completed, Ian Fletcher starts his new life as head of values at the BBC. Contains some strong language. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: W1A
item.dc:description: 2/4. Ian Fletcher is interviewed on Woman's Hour about an age discrimination scandal at the BBC. Contains some strong language. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: W1A
item.dc:description: 3/4. Comedy sequel to Twenty Twelve. The debate about the future of the BBC is not helped when Ian's salary comes under intense scrutiny in the press. Contains some strong language. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Rev.
item.dc:description: 2/6. Comedy about the vicar of an inner-city church. Adam is asked to perform a gay wedding. Can he help them and stick to church law? Contains some strong language. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: Rev.
item.dc:description: 3/6. Sitcom about a vicar running an inner-city church. Adam is intrigued when a local artist offers to make a £60k donation to St Saviour's. Contains some strong language. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: W1A
item.dc:description: 4/4. Comedy sequel to Twenty Twelve. A national paper reveals Ian Fletcher's salary and that he took his PA on holiday to Italy. Contains some strong language. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: The Trip to Italy
item.dc:description: New series. 1/6. Il Cenobio dei Dogi, Camogli: Rob Brydon and Steve Coogan begin their road trip around Italy in Piemonte. Contains some strong language. [HD] [AD,S]

item.dc:title: The Trip to Italy
item.dc:description: 2/6. Da Giovanni, San Fruttuoso: Comedy series. Rob Brydon and Steve Coogan journey around Italy to review six restaurants. On a boat trip, they also stop at Percy Shelley's house. [HD] [AD,S]
